author: Danielle S
title: Early Pregnancy Unit Barnet
body:
Chaotic and unorganised. Lack of communication with the patient. Rather than that staff and reception prefer to walk around, print and have a private chat where you are not included.  
After a scan they have asked to wait on the corridor when someone will be available to discuss your findings. It was after 5.00 pm so everyone went home passing me by like I never existed. I needed to request a Nurse to see as I had enough of being ignored. I have been told I am unwell and I have a temperature so maybe perhaps I should see a doctor. But they don't have a clue when it will be possible, as he is in the ward somewhere. I said definitely no as I have been there since 2.00 pm and any doctors never acknowledged me, despite the fact that I was seating there unwell for last three hours waiting for my scan and I was passed by at least three doctors where no one said anything.  
Really bad service and experience. Maybe for the future a patient should be a priority not printing and conversation?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Laineygirl
title: Care of my Dad
body:
Dad was cared for in Ward 22, Monklands Hospital, he had many health concerns and the Medical and Nursing staff did everything they possibly could to help him. They realised treatment wasn’t working and asked to speak to the family.  
He was put onto palliative care, treated with care, dignity and respect until he passed away last week!  
Thank you to everyone who made losing a true family man a little bit easier.

author: Worried Maw
title: Kindness and care in Glasgow
body:
My daughter had a nasty tonsillitis over the weekend which didn't get any better. Her throat was very swollen, and painkillers weren't making any difference. As she lives in Glasgow and I live in Perth, it made the situation very worrying. She was seen by a lovely out of hours doctor in the Royal Alexandra Hospital who acted quickly and referred her to ward 11b at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital, Glasgow. We had a bit of a panic, because it wasn't clear where to go at the QEUH out of hours, before my daughter figured out she could get in via A&E, so some added distress could have been avoided with clearer instructions. I had left Perth at this point - 1:30 am - and I was shown to the lifts by a really helpful A&E receptionist at QEUH. By the time I arrived at ward 11b, she'd had a peritonsillar abscess drained (quinsy) by an incredibly kind doctor who had given her a hug - as a mum that gave me great comfort - and was tucked up in bed on IV fluids and antibiotics. The night shift nurses were lovely, very concerned and attentive, checking my daughter's pain levels.  
The consultant arrived in the morning and was really approachable, he made it easy to ask questions about the next steps.  
The day shift staff were great, offering much kindness and care.  
I was really grateful, right from the diagnosis to all of her treatment and I wanted to share our experience. I hope the staff will hear about how much of a difference their kindness and care really made to us.

title: Too many patients not enough GP’s!
body: This morning I was due an appointment that I’d waited 3 weeks for, an hour before it was cancelled, no apology or reasons as to why? Trying to ring through to re-book another appointment is ridiculous! I’ve waited on numerous occasions over an hour to get through to somebody at this large call centre that clearly isn’t fit for purpose! Why has the appointment system changed and why haven’t patients been informed that this is now how it works?!? Why are patients having to be waiting weeks to be seen?!? This isn’t acceptable!! If you can’t see patients within a suitable time frame then why not close your books to new patients, you have nearly 14’000 patients on your books so there is no wonder we are struggling to get an appointment with you! Please sort this out!!!

title: Good Job
body: I am happy about all the staff and also for the service! Always when I need help all the staff is helpful for all my family! Thank you so much!

title: Really bad service and not answering calls
body:
Such a bad service overall 
Had to keep calling chasing up what i had requested but nothing was done about it. Also requested for a call back but guess what ..... not received a call back. After trying to get through by calling they wouldnt answer so i visited the surgery and to my surprise was not even busy with only one patient there. When i questioned this to the staff who seemed to be in a hurry to go home they replied we have not received any calls. I showed them my phones yes both phones i called from to show i made over 40 calls trying to get through. They had atleast 5/6 staff that were still there. After this event on Friday and deciding to see if they chase up what they do on Monday and to not my surprise they have not done anything. I called on Monday for an update and spoke to the lady Again who i spoke to on Friday and she replied she will call and chase it up. I advised her to call me back for an update but once again this did not happen. So trying to call again and after making 20 calls was in line at number 2 after 5 mins lines starts ringing and ringing and ringing but no one answered and after 15 mins line dropped. What kind of service do you actually call this? How appalled i am with the lack of service from this branch. I would like to officially log a complaint to the senior and will be taking this further.

title: Just what I needed
body: I saw a very empathic GP who spent her time making me feel reassured and understanding not only my physical symptoms but the subsequent impact on how I felt. Really appreciated. She also left a follow up plan outside of the appointment (if needed) which thankfully wasn’t.

title: Trauma Team
body: So caring staff. Had half plaster removed for full plaster. Staff so relaxed and friendly that you forget totally you are in a hospital. Speed with which they execute is second to none

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Amazing care
body:
attended the Welcome unit for another biopsy this time I was transferred to the East Block day unit and I can honestly say the staff were amazing, the care I receive each time I visit is always wonderful.My consultant is fantastic he always has time for any questions,thankfully my biopsy results were negative and I will need two more rounds of surgery which I strangely look forward to,
Well done and keep up the fabulous work you do .

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful doctors
body: I have just had an appointment with a particular doctor Who has been extremely helpful and professional? With my needs. An absolute asset to your surgery. A wonderful and caring doctor Which are hard to find nowadays. Has the time and patience? To listen to you. I would like to thank her very much for all the help. She is giving me. over the years. And to another Dr Once again, thank you very much.

title: A few things to grumble about
body: I was very upset by the vestibular clinic, its on the 5th floor with floor to ceiling windows and i had really bad vertigo as soon as i walked in and it messed my whole appointment up, i was in no fit state, the specialist was extremely rude and unhelpful towards me, i felt so depressed when i left, i waited two years for the appointment to come and that happens. they tried to tell me i have migraine but would not listen to me when i tried to tell them i already been through the migraine part at the same hospital a decade previous and this is how long it has taken me to get back, very upsetting.

title: Pelvic Health Physiotherapy
body: I fully recommend this hospital for physio in the pelvic health region. I went with incontinence and stress incontinence and with the advice and exercise regime received, I managed to overcome my symptoms within a matter of months. The physiotherapist was so helpful and sympathetic and made me feel at ease and explained clearly how to deal with things and also gave me some handouts on what was discussed during each appointment. On the whole an excellent department and physiotherapist.

title: Worse practice ever!
body:
This place is absolutely diabolical. It’s become a joke. I have been trying to book an appointment for the past week but have had no luck. The phone is either constantly engaged or left unanswered. They claim that their busiest time is from 9am-11am and 2pm-4pm, but if you don’t call as soon as the surgery opens, then you won’t get an appointment. So it’s a no win situation. The staff don’t care and are not sympathetic at all. They also claim that you can book online - which I’ve tried but appointments are not available until 3/4 weeks later! 

I don’t have a problem with the doctors. My problem is with the appointment system which is the worse I have ever seen; and also of the rude, poorly behaved, arrogant staff.

author: Another worried patient
title: Sent my child home ......
body:
Twice now my small child has been to our local GP service and seen by a practise nurse. My child had been sent home saying it’s just a virus when he had pneumonia and only recently another chest infection. It’s taken me nhs24 calls and a trip in an ambulance and out of hours appointments before my son got the right care and put on antibiotics.  
Both times the nurse from gp practice had told me it’s just noise from his throat and winter bugs. I felt I was shown no understanding and compassion for my concerns and feel I was given no advice on managing symptoms or when to have cause for concern. I was told only bring back if not better! I have had several visits to the gp over the last few weeks until the only way I know my child would get the right care is to visit the hospital. My child’s symptoms ranged from high temp, not eaten in over a week, in total two weeks and a chesty cough that clearly sounded unhealthy as well as working the chest cavity harder. It’s taken for my child to become very sick before getting medicine.

author: Jeaqg99
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Caring staff at Somerford Grove
body:
I would like to extend my gratitude to the reception staff and doctors at this practice who after an issue with an appointment was resolved in a call with the duty doctor and an afternoon appointment.  
I often hear negative comments about other practices, so in challenging times I would like to acknowledge the great work at Somerford Grove. Thank you for caring.

title: over 3 weeks to get referred to hospital…
body: Visited this doctors surgery in December and was told that they would refer me to 2 different departments at the Royal Hospital.  nearly 4 weeks later I had to ring them about an unrelated matter and while talking to them I asked about these referrals and was told the doctor only done them 2 days earlier, as they had been on holiday.  so while they enjoying holidays I am suffering. don't bother joining this surgery, they seem to relish in your agony.

title: Abysmal awaiting times
body: Have had to wait 1 1/2 hrs to be triaged by a nurse, now we have to wait up to 4 hours to be seen by a doctor. Hardly any seats left in waiting area.

title: Thank you to Ward 34
body:
After a traumatic hip fracture, I was quickly triaged by A&E and put on Ward 34 prior to my new hip op.   The staff on the Ward were caring and looked after me and the others throughout my stay...on the day shift and the night shift.
Many thanks to everyone

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Doctors, Poor Reception
body:
This review is for reception staff at Walkley House medical centre. Since their customer service has in 90% been poor, I have decided to book my appintments on-line and use the electronic device in reception area to check in. 
On 03.02.2020, I needed an emergency appointment. This cannot be booked on-line. Two hours after nearly fainting from pain at home, I got at reception. It was 08:40 am. I explained to the receptionist I needed an emergency appointment and the reasons for it. She quickly replied: ''Sorry, no emergency appointments available. They've all gone.'' She did not ask any questions to triage the degree of urgency in this case.
Instead, it was suggested to visit the Walk-in centre or call 111.
I have been a registered patient at this practice for 8 years with immaculate attendance history.  
The receptionist's actions were negligent, unprofessional and overall poor.   
I am a dentist myself and had to take time off work, just to face this. I have been deprived from my right as a patient due to the receptionist.
Frankly, the great doctors working at this practice, deserve better. A big Thank You to my treating doctor, who has always listened, cared and treated promptly.

title: Fantastic Team
body: the team worked extremely hard to help me. i am a nervous patient who is not the best in medical environments but the team kept me smiling the whole way through when they could

title: Excellent standard of care
body: I was brought to A&E and then on to ACC, where I was treated expertly and with clear professionalism and compassion by a particular Consultant and Nurse.  It was very reassuring during a scary time.  The Consultant is clearly extremely competent and adept at what he does. My very grateful thanks to all the staff, especially the Consultant.

title: Appalling Service
body: SUTTON Uplift offer an appalling service - I have been waiting for 7 months after being referred for help following a cancer diagnosis. I was given an initial telephone assessment and told that I could only be referred for computerised help - I would receive login details within 12 weeks - I have heard nothing since despite contacting them by telephone. Good job I wasn't suicidal - I would be dead by now.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: well looked after
body: nervous when we arrived and soon calmed us down great place to go. slightly long wait as they were very busy and running behind there appointments times but we were kept well up to date.

title: Terrible service
body:
Wait 5h in emergency, short of breth with asthma, and no one of the nurses and doctors really show any care of the problem.Why there was need of waiting that much and not been referred to specialists, my GP didn’t had any availability for the next 3 weeks too. Come on, time to woke up, we need a good doctors who care for our health!!!!!

Terrible service, I don’t recommend it at all

title: Above and Beyond
body:
I cannot speak highly enough of the care that is offered at Alveley Medical Practice. The Doctors show genuine care towards their patients. 
My Doctor makes time to listen, showing care and consideration. I put all my trust in my Doctor, knowing they have my best interests at heart. 
The staff on the front desk are kind, helpful and professional. They remember the names of the patients, offering a personal touch and are very welcoming. 
Thank you to all at Alveley Medical Practice. You work so hard and are the best at what you do. You’re all wonderful.

title: Disgusting Toilets
body:
Attempted to use the toilets by A&E today. I was disgusted at how dirty the toilets were at 9.30am. The toilets were soiled on the seats and had clearly not been washed overnight. 

Considering the hospital is supposed to be concerned about hygiene standards it was shocking. A disgrace.

title: Tonsil surgery
body: My 3 year old son having sleep apnea GP made an appointment to see the consultant on 8th of January and they suggest that they have to take the tonsil out .they said wont be long within couple of weeks we will send a date for the surgery as he really struggling with sleep and breathing received a letter last week .I thought they send a date I was shocked it's saying we will try to get a date in few months time .as my baby still couldn't sleep ,breathe every single night

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body:
Would just like to say thank you to the Dr & staff in the Endocrinology Clinic today. You have all been professional, kind & supportive, which was very much appreciated.
Also thank you to the lady from PALS (you know who you are 😉), who kindly attended my appointment with me. Your support ment more than you know.

title: Don’t go
body:
Not helpful at all I’m disabled my husband just out of hospital following a heart attack we have no care plan so went to ask again twice now for myself not managing to cope was told in so many words you came 2 month and asked go away now nothing we can do 
My husband is eating out of cans because when I’m ill I can’t funtion and even when l ask if someone can phone to see if he ok he’s still having problems they get a paramedic to phone not a doctor and we have got to go through everything again and still get no where Iv explained some times l feel like l cantgo on andstill get the same response 
This is not careing from a practice

title: Basic Life Support Course 2015 Guidelines
body:
I visited the Pennywell Medical Centre in the company of colleagues from the Patients Participation Group to take part in a course about CPR/SEPSIS Training and this was arranged by Sunderland GP Alliance. Which was very useful, informative and helpful into our understanding into how to help members of the public suffering from a medical emergency. 
We covered a wide range of subjects such as Sepsis Awareness, AED Defibrillation, Resuscitation Skills, Adult and Paediatric Basic Life Support, Asphyxiation/Choking and how to recognise and manage Anaphylactic Shock.

title: A credit to Health Care Services
body: This hospital is fantastic. The staff are polite and cheerful. From my initial NHS consultation to being admitted and having the surgury carried out, i have been cared for at the highest level. You will not be disapointed using this hospital. Thank you to everyone at The Spire Tunbridge Wells

title: Possible Life Saver
body:
Went into Reception to collect wife's prescription. Receptionist looked at a dark line under my finger nail and suggested I make an appointment to see a my GP. An appointment that was due at the time I was there hadn't turned up, so they asked if I had a few minutes now, and they'd check to see if the doctor would see me instead. Doctor agreed - I now have a referral to the Dermatology unit at local hospital with a suspect myeloma.

If not for the Receptionist noticing what the mark under my fingernail MIGHT be serious (as nothing confirmed until I've had my appointment) I would have merrily gone on my way. If it turns out to be the worst, I then need to get tests to see if the myeloma is present anywhere else / has spread from the nail into other systems. 

Regardless as to whether this is a myeloma or a skin blister that's ruptured or something daft, Receptionist was calm, reassuring and very correct to push me to see GP. 

Being honest, they told me to book an appointment the next day, but I doubted how serious this could possibly be and wouldnt have done so - I'd  feel as though I was wasting their time! 

It was only the fact that a patient hadn't bothered to attend that they substituted me in and now I'm on the path to knowing what I might face.

Whatever the outcome, thank you for being so vigilant.

title: Where do I start?
body:
This Surgery used to be good but of the past couple of years has really started to go downhill.

Trying to get to see a GP is like a lottery.  You can either wait a while month for an appt or ring at 8am and chance your look getting an available one for that morning.  Even then you cant get through as so many other people are trying to get appts and the phone is constantly engaged.

Ordering repeat prescriptions is hit and miss also.  they state 48 hrs for repeats but sometime on day 3 its still not ready and "waiting to be signed".  If its 48 hrs from when you order it make sure it is 48 hrs and NOT 48 hrs from when they print it out.  

I also find some of the receptionists very rude and some of them have no concept of customer service.  When you ask them for a prescription they huff and puff whilst they flick through the pile of prescriptions trying to find yours.

Sort it out.

title: Great service
body: I got an appointment when I needed it. The GP was excellent. The secretary processed the referral within 24 hours and I have a hospital appointment for next week. Amazing service from Monton Medical Centre and the NHS

title: Terrible practice
body: This surgery and the staff specially reception are terrible. They are very very rude and show no sympathy towards you. You call in the morning only to be put on hold for good 20 mins then they tell you they don’t have appointments available. They don’t care if it’s an emergency. The receptionist actually had the audacity to put the phone down on me. She is ever rude. I wish I never went to them. I am defo moving from this place. Please everyone stay away from this practice. You will just be a number for them they don’t care about their patients. Utterly disappointed

title: great practice
body: All the doctors are very caring and the service is outstanding.On my last visit I required I was seen promptly and as is usual if its not urgent an appointment can be made within a week. If urgent you can be seen that day by waiting in the surgery  in the morning up to 10.30

title: Cant get through
body: Can never get appointment anymore even if it were life threatening i still xant get through death is a better option

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Poor service
body: telephoned Monday told no doctor's appointment told to phone today at 8 phoned told this number does not except calls again at 10 past 8 and 20 past 8 got to talk to someone at 08,35 told no doctor appointment available ask can l book for tomorrow told they can not book for tomorrow ask if l would see any doctor l told the lady last time l saw a different doctor to make appointment to see my GP which l can not as none available till march

title: Waste of important resources!
body:
Phoned for a blood test appointment.
Pressed one for appointments 3rd in the Q 14 minutes later ( screenshot for evidence.)
The recording never mentioned only medical appointments.
When I eventually got through you not only wasted my time as you are in the same building but don’t take blood appointments!
I was the given a direct number for bloods.
Turned out to be for lee health center????
The same number beside every health center blood testing sites 
What a waste of everyone’s time NHS going downhill................
Disgusting!

title: Disappointed
body: I damaged my back in December, badly. I then developed pain in my hip generating down my leg and into my foot and also developed dropfoot, which i still have. Had consultation with physiotherapist and doctor who advised on having an x-ray. If nothing conclusive from x-ray then mri. Called surgery yesterday, 04/02/20, for x-ray result and was informed that no action to be taken. So, what about the dropfoot i've been left with. No, action, no advice, nothing! Extremely disappointed to say the least!!

title: Worst practice ever
body:
The receptionist people are rude and think that they have the power to treat you like rubbish. Can never get an appointment and when you push them either they cut the phone on you or magically have an inconvenient date and time after 20 minutes of arguments. 

Disgusting treatment and very disappointed. Rude and definitely need to go under investigation for how this practice is run.

title: Best surgery
body: I have a very positive experience from this surgery, very good staff, reception. Doctors are very professional, assessed me and addressed my concerns. I was able to get appointment online. I am really satisfied with reception and doctors, will recommend to others.

author: MFMMM
title: Physiotherapy after broken wrist
body:
Physio is doing a great job - but unfortunately does not have access to my x-rays which means that they cannot easily pinpoint the causes of my pain.  
They tell me that the system can't do it.  
I am sure my recovery would be faster if all the data was available at physio.

title: Can't get seen
body:
You are no longer able to book an appointment. Routine appointments have a very long wait list, and if you need an emergency appointment you cannot get a time slot.

Instead you have to wait for them to call you back to book you in to a first come first seen clinic.

title: Outstanding care
body:
I accompanied my mum to a colonoscopy appointment that had been arranged by the bowel screening service at the treatment centre at Withington hospital. 

The care from arrival to discharge by the treatment centre staff was outstanding.
From the lovely greeting on arrival at reception, being kept informed of unavoidable delays, receiving full explanations of what was going to happen by the Dr and nursing staff, being able to wait with my Mum until it was her turn, to the kind nurse completing the discharge, the team couldn't have done more.

Whilst my Mum was undergoing the procedure and recovery i sat  in the waiting area and observed care and compassion from EVERY member of staff. 

The cataract service is run from the same area and the team there were equally kind and and caring to all their patients and relatives, especially the lovely receptionist who kept patients informed regarding waits for patient transport and ensured they were comfortable and had refreshments if required.

As individuals working in this department you should all be really proud of yourselves and as a trust congratulate these wonderful staff for the fantastic service they are providing to patients.

You are the best of the best and a credit to the NHS

title: Lovely friendly dr
body: My appointment was running 15 minutes behind but i didn't mind as i was told this on the screen when i signed in. The dr i saw was lovely.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Getting no where
body: I was given a diagnosis in September 2019 and was told in the October treatment would start ASAP, well nothing has changed and won't till I get mri right up from scans done in October. I've been trying to speak to pals for a fortnight and I'm not getting calls back.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Friendly practices
body: It was nice and easy .Good communication they don’t take waiting time longer and staff are very helpful and friendly.

title: Patient information
body:
I recently called for the surgery for an emergency appointment. I was treated by a practice nurse who was very helpful and informative and suggested I had a blood test. The printer in the treatment room did not work so I was advised to speak to a receptionist to get a form for a blood tests. When I got home I realised the receptionist had given me two additional patients blood test forms that contained sensitive and highly personal information. The forms were promptly returned to the surgery however, I feel this incident should not have happened. The  receptionist was aware of my name and date of birth which should  eliminate incorrect information going to a patient. What are the procedures to ensure the correct details are given to the right patients? 
Receptionist must understand the importance of patients confidentiality to ensure errors like this are not repeated.

title: A&E absolutely avoid going there
body: I went to A&E very recently with severe lower abdominal pain. Although I was seen fairly quickly, I was immediately told by a Dr who examined me that if the bloods came back OK nobody would see me/nothing would be done. I had a known ovarian cyst from a previous scan. I had to reiterate that I was in a lot of pain and was eventually sent to GUA. I had a pelvic exam and swabs taken but basically told they don't know what it is causing the pain and sent home with pain killers. No scan was done, was told to wait for a gynae appointment in a few weeks time. My symptoms are still the same, I'm taking pain killers not knowing what is going on

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: BreH
title: Nursing care
body:
Yesterday I was in Monklands accident emergency with a family member when I witnessed the most undignified, unprofessional and down right ignorance of a staff nurse regarding a patient.  
I have been in healthcare a very long time and have worked in busy departments like this one so I know how hard and stressful the job can be at times.  
There is no words or excuses for the way a nurse treated a patient in front of others in my eyes!  
I was in ear shot of a nurse belittling a patient, speaking to them in a manner to which no person should be spoken to, especially by someone in a position to help others.  
Statements along the lines of “I’m sick of her” , “I hate this place because of people like her” “I’m not doing anything for you because it’s a waste of my time”  
Not only did I hear this nurse moan for the full time I was in nearby but I also know quite a lot about their colleagues they do and don’t not like, their person life and how they feel about management.  
Again I understand people have hard days and that’s understandable but when your holding a sick child and this is what you hear knowing it is very wrong I have to voice my complaint.  
I was so enraged with the whole situation I took it upon myself to ask the receptionist what this nurse was called. My advice to you is.. i think a little discretion can go a long way. Please be mindful other patients and family members have ears and know right from wrong. And in this case you are in the wrong with the attitude you carry.

author: Painkiller
title: Strong pain around the stomach area
body:
Painkiller lovers! Been there with a strong pain around the stomach area after have been sick few months.  
Been in the Emergency last night due my daughter pain around the stomach area. After the first doctor check (pressure), the very impolite and rude doctor, started to suggest painkillers! After a waiting of 3 hours (due our case was underestimate) we ve seen another doctor.  
This one, just asking a few question, without any test, , had the diagnosis and the cure: _painkillers!_ I had to insist and finally my daughter had a urine test, and, came out an infection of urine tract infection, so the painkillers won't help and finally we ve got antibiotics! I was shocked honestly. First, there is a lethal epidemic around, (coronavirus), I would expect a high state of alert, but unfortunately didn't see any. Second, treating and dismissing patients with pain just with painkillers, without any kind of test, is extremely dangerous, because if the patient has a pain is an alarm bell and with painkillers, if he's getting worse, can't feel anything..so you condemned him!  
The Hospital makes the Doctors into painkiller dispensers! Stop to play with human's life, that is not a joke!

author: LolaC25
title: Ectopic Pregnancy
body: I recently attended Maternity Triage after having an early private scan due to spotting/ light bleeding for over 2 weeks daily. They found a live ectopic in my right Fallopian Tube and I was rushed by Ambulance to Wishaw. In my arrival to triage in a wheelchair the paramedics done a handover and I felt that all of the staff just stared at me blankly even when I was visibly anxious and upset and I was made to sit in a waiting room for over an hour around pregnant women, some in labour, which was very upsetting for me as my baby was obviously going to be removed from me. My partner didn't know where I was and I had no phone battery so I asked to contact my mum on the phone at nurses station, again I felt like I was stared at blankly and told they were busy and they would let me know. Eventually my partner found me followed by my mum and step-dad. We sat for another long time before I became very concerned and upset and my mum pushed for them to give me a bed as this was an emergency. They said that they couldn't go by the private scan report and that it wasn't an emergency as I had no symptoms (I felt as if they were waiting on me rupturing before they would help me). I was then told by a member of staff not to listen to people when they say ectopic as it might not be and not to worry yet. I explained that I have seen the baby in the scan in the tube and they stated that they hadn't even read the report and went to go read it. I then announced that I was a staff member and that was when the staff became much kinder to me and I was taken more seriously. Eventually the lovely consultant came to see me after the report was read and I was given another scan, which proved what I already knew and then emergency Laparoscopy with right salpingectomy. I just hope that a similar thing doesn't happen to someone else as it was a terrifying experience and I could have ruptured and died all because they didn't bother to read the report as it was a private scan, even though I had bleeding and previous reccurent miscarriages increasing my risks. I understand the need to re-scan me and to do further tests, but the fact is I was brought in with a query ectopic and that should have been enough to indicate the need for urgent medical assessment and a bit of more respect and kindness towards me considering I was alone and petrified.

title: Calling reception
body: On Monday I made in excess of 80 phone call to surgery continuously. When I eventually got through having been ringing since 0800 it was 0915. I was told there were no appointments left. How on earth is this possible? Luckily the receptionist arranged for duty doctor to call me.

author: LolaC25
title: Keep doing what you are all doing!
body:
I was brought to hospital following a private scan due to spotting/bleeding and as I'd had previous early miscarriages in a row prior. The scan showed a live ectopic in my fallopian tube and after another scan at Wishaw to confirm same I was taken for Laparoscopy and Salpingectomy surgery. My consultant Dr. Kumar was so amazing and kind and explained it all alongside one of the nurses who was assisting with the scan. I was absolutely petrified of imminent rupture and dying and the whole team involved in my surgery were very reassuring throughout, one nurse in particular held my hand while I was put under general anaesthesia and was there when I woke up she was great at keeping me calm. Back in the gynaecology ward I would also like to say how understanding the nursing staff were as due to bed shortages I was unable to have my own private room, which was normally the case after such surgery. They allowed me to keep my curtains closed to avoid me feeling exposed and vulnerable while I recovered the next day as I was very upset and in a 5 bedded bay with other, mostly older women.  
Thank you so much for all of your kindness and support through one of the most traumatic and upsetting times of my life, it won't be forgotten. Keep doing what you are all doing!

author: Raphael
title: Ambrose King Clinic
body:
I could not leave a review on Google Reviews (technical issues) hence sharing my experience here.  
I have been to Ambrose King Clinic several times. It has been nicely refurbished. The staff has been professional and pleasant.  
My complaint is about their horrible time management. Every time I come I wait around an hour to be seen (appointment) for a minute. If I wait one hour each time, it is a pattern showing a normalised dysfunction.  
The receptionist gave me the most idiotic excuses ever.  
Firstly I was told that it is a free care clinic.  
What I am hearing is that if something is free it has to be inefficient by default. Of course, it it not free NHS care. I pay very high taxes for the NHS. I do not receive free care. It is paid for.  
The second excuse was that ”everywhere is like this”. A very _poor_ excuse not to be better organised.  
Let us keep our definitions clean. A 10am appointment, for example, means that the client is seen at 10am, not 11am. If you have a policy of seeing clients within an hour, do not call it an appointment, and also why are you _unable_ to have a standard-basic on time appointments. I keep hearing it is _normal _in London. It is bad time management. Let us call it what it is.  
Should you need a tutorial on how to manage your appointments I am happy to give you one.

title: Great treatment and handling
body: I had a shoulder op, all the staff were informative, caring and pleasant.  The treatment I received was excellent

title: Dissapointing
body: I injured my leg in 2016, GP was to refer me several times to hospitals for physiotherapy and surgery however they still have not to a point my leg is so weak and I cannot walk on it - ITS 2020!

title: Waste of Time
body:
Yet again spent over 90 minutes phoning the surgery including being cut off several times. Only to be told that yet again there wasn't any appointments. I was then told to apply for an appointment online. 

Surprisingly again an email was sent in minutes telling me no appointments or to use the up to 6 hours wait walk in centre or go through the joke of playing Russian roulette by the god like rude receptionists.

Don't bother asking me to contact the practice manager as obliviously since 90% of the reviews on here outlay the problems this practice has and it is being ignored.

title: Great practice
body: Having visited the medical centre today my experience was totally different. I understand I was totally unreasonable on my previous encounter. Plus I was made aware that there were other options available to me,I would recommend that everyone takes time to find out the options. which will make the experience of making appointments a lot more acceptable, and have actually made it more efficient.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: Never able to get an appointment when needed and if you do get one they run very late. Waited over an hour last time.

title: Awful service
body:
Due to the redevelopment of Vicarage fields my family have been passed to this surgery. I have noted the rudeness of staff on reception and inconsistency of information provided in general. However, l am writing this review to highlight how ineffective the service provided here is. l went into the surgery on the 28 January to bring in a letter from my sons hospital appointment stating his medication should be increased, the letter was a copy as the hospital doctor had faxed the same letter over that day at the same time I requested a repeat 
prescription for myself as information in the surgery state repeat prescriptions turnaround time is 72 hours l thought l would get my prescription by the Friday/Saturday. Needless to say l had to return to the surgery on Monday 3/2/20 as the chemist was not faxed my repeat prescription and was told it was faxed to the chemist on the 2/2/20 - which is over the 72 hours timelime and that she could not advise about my sons prescription. I collected my medication yesterday and am will waiting for my sons prescription which is extremely important due to his illness and the fact that the medication was increased. l called the surgery this morning  to find out what is happening and advise if the importance that my son gets his medication, that l had bought in a copy of the hospital letter over a week ago and that as my sons medication is running out. l advised l will come in and collect the prescription to be to!d by the receptionist l just call before l come to the surgery she is trying to help me and will not continue to help as o am talking to her in 'a tone'.  There was no acknowledgement that that she had listened to what l had told her that the medication was running out, that the hospital had increased my sons medication from the 28/1/20 and that l had bought in a copy of the hospital the same day over a week ago and nothing had been done to date, no the receptionist seemed to feel the service being provided was fine. Words fail me as to the customer service being provided at this surgery . I will be reporting this experience my sons  hospital doctor today so he can request that this is looked into. The victim in all of this is the customers which cannot be right.

author: mummy2boys
title: It was lovely seeing the same person for every appointment
body:
Having recently given birth to our second son I just waned to give feedback on the named midwife system which is in place. We had no issues with the care received 5 years ago with our first son however I feel this has taken the level of service to another level. From my first meeting with Sharon at my booking appointment I felt at ease and having a number to contact her directly on was great, I was able to text her to check things and knowing that she knew me made all the difference, I felt comfortable messaging or speaking to her in appointments about anything! It was lovely seeing the same person for every appointment and build a relationship, especially with something like a pregnancy. Also being offered accupuncture and aromatherapy was a lovely addition to the service which i loved!  
When it came to my actual delivery unfortunately Sharon wasn't available however Elizabeth and Lorna (also blue team) were amazing during my very quick water birth, they both kept me calm and my aftercare from them was amazing. Sharon heard about my sons arrival whilst away as she kept checking with her team as she knew I was overdue so sent me her congratulations as soon as she was back in work. I was happy to see her for my last home visits and be able to introduce her to my son, he definately recognised her voice and I am just sad that our visits are over

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

title: excellent throughout
body:
Very speedy service from start to finish Treated with extreme courtesy by all staff My most sincere thanks to all
Nicholas Woodward

title: mri dept
body: attended for a head scan ,but arrived 2 hrs before actual appointment ,kind staff phoned me as I sat just before I ordered a coffee knowing I had a long wait, to tell me to go back to mri dept as they were doing the scan straight away .all over and finished within 45 mins of arriving at the hospital. staff in the dept were very kind and helpful ,best experience at any hospital after many years of attending various locations .

title: extremely rude staff
body:
attended as a visitor and went to nip loo that wasn't an assisted toilet.  healthcare assistant informed that there was one free, upon walking over she asked if I was a patient so I said no, im a visitor, then shouted well you can't use it then, they are for patients only, upon asking if she meant the one she had directed me too, or just the assisted one, she scouled and insisted again I couldn't use any of them.  tried to ask where the nearest one was and she walked off.

didn't need the attitude! I didn't see any signs, nor am I (thankfully) a regular hospital visitor to know. just appalling attitude.

title: I left my appointment in tears due to not being…
body:
I have left the surgery in tears after my doctor gave me the impression they would discuss everything I had requested to, only for the doctor to dictate which problem they would deal with and then blatantly refuse to help me with the main issue I had booked the appointment for.
I feel like I have had my time wasted, I have had to book yet another appointment for the same issue I expected to be dealt with in my most recent appointment, and I feel let down by my doctor.
No patient should feel more hopeless following a doctor's appointment due to their doctor refusing to speak with them. No patient should leave the surgery in tears due to the negative attitude of their doctor. This is the second time I have left this doctor feeling like I have not been helped or cared for.

title: Lovely practice
body: Great clinic, clean, staff efficient, parking not a problem, overall experience, well look after with everything explained in great detail for the treatment that I will be having.

author: controllermw98
title: The staff were amazing and made me feel so comfortable.
body: I recently went in to Queen Margaret hospital for day surgery. I can honestly say from the minute I arrived to the minute I left, that the staff were amazing and made me feel so comfortable. Even after my procedure I felt quite unwell and they looked after me and were so nice. I feel so bad that I can’t remember anyone’s names. I do remember that every staff member that spoke to me that day were very helpful and friendly, making my experience at the hospital a good memory. A huge thank you.

title: Emergency appointments
body: I called in on Wednesday 5th Feb to try book an appointment for a tablet review, but need it asap due to my 88yr old mum starting cancer treatment soon and as she will have to go 5 days a week for radiotherapy and I will be taking her I'm unable to p,an anything,but to get a review I will have to phone at 8am and take up an appointment that a poorly person will need,this is totally unacceptable,so if you cannot get an appointment you now know why

author: Drumchapel2020
title: The tone they say things completely comes off wrong
body:
I understand reception staff see and hear a lot and are a hard working front line to our services.  
A few times i have been in and heard the reception moan about their boss and started and finish times. How this isnt the area to be waiting around on a dark night and this is not happening. I thought unwise to verbally mock the area which those in the waiting area reside but it was just me on the waiting area once and the next time elderly patients.  
Although it is only one particular receptionist the other are polite but will still band together against any comment on the behaviour. I do not feel able to approach management with any positive outcome because of their friednly relationship with the reception desk.  
For months i have watched as a passive observer with others experiencing it but my kids went with their dads for an appointment and tried to explain the kids had access online (from previous practice) rather than say its individual rules that the practice has made to not allow under 16s. They decide to tell him he was wrong and they didn't want to see proof he had that they had it previously as he was wrong.  
He said he will ask the doctor and the response was why i deal with it and the doctor will not know better than me. It is the way the receptionist says things and the tone that completely come off wrong. Everyone knows it but nobody addresses it. Unless you experience it you would not believe it.  
I called up after to make an appointment to speak to someone in charge and was told they were on annual leave, the other reception went to the length to down play the interaction. Other receptionist told me that they looked it up and although their dad was right each practice makes its own version of patient access. Now was that hard i dont believe so - this should have been done at the beginning not told he was wrong it never happens when he has it on his phone it front of their face. People are not expected to know everything but when you act like you do, this happens.  
The GPs in this practice i must say are brilliant i have went from strength to strength with their assistance.  
Based on previous interactions i am not impressed this person's attitude to the community they serve.  
I know people sitting in older adults who where shocked about the situation. My son is a quiet boy and found it an uncomfortable experience. Their Dad who has never said a cross word came out fuming and embarrassed after being calmed and advised by the gp on how to deal with situation through the correct channels .  
You can have opinions about an area and i believe this person is from said area but in a professional capacity you should have the customer service face on and admit when you dont know something. This particular interaction could have been solved by taking the phone number and getting back to me about patient access. I wish it was simple to correct but it seems its lack of professional values at heart.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: An asset to any team that saves addicts lives
body:
Very briefly! I was in a very desperate position 'begging, heavily addicted using lots of Heroin and Crack with a very bleak outlook. I had no contact with services and no connections with anyone no family or friends etc.  
Outreach met me in a doorway and led me to where I am today; scripted on Methadone, no longer begging or breaking the law to support an ever increasing addiction. I now have positivity and direction, early days yet, however I would certainly of been dead now if I hadn't been scripted. So all in all outreach and services saved my life. My worker Becky is an absolute legend, and I am sure an asset to any team that saves addicts life's.

title: Absolutely appalling
body: Today I visited the ICC dermatologist in Oldham. The lady basically told me there’s nothing anyone can do because my acne is hormonal (there is things that can be done, I know this because I’ve had acne for 15 years) she then said she can prescribe me a cream, when i asked what was in it she didn’t even know & had to look it up. Turns out this cream is what I’ve already used & it didn’t work, but she said ‘well do you want me to prescribe it’ I asked what other options I had & she told me to go back to my GP to speak about my other options. She was meant to be the skin specialist helping me with my nodular cystic acne but she did nothing at all to help & I left feeling even worse than before I went in. I will definitely consider going private for my acne as the Oldham dermatology department today made me feel so upset & was completely useless. She also said I could try a different contraceptive method, & when I asked what, she said ‘well I can’t advice on that’ so I really don’t see any point in my appointment today & I will never use this service again. It felt like she didn’t care about my issue & didn’t have any intentions of helping or advising me.

author: Hannah21
title: My wonderful experience in hospital
body:
I had a wonderful experience on Hatton ward. Particularly by Sammi and Amanda, the nurses. They made me feel so relaxed and comfortable, at ease and looked after me so well. I can’t thank them enough for the personal care they gave and made sure I felt safe with my issues and I did. Thank you for making a terrible, terrifying injury into an experience that has given me hope to start again and reassurance I’m going to be okay.  
Thank you

title: gone downhill
body: ever since their "new" computer system was installed (which took a month) its impossible to book an appointment I was told "they only release appointments in batches" so you have to ring 3 or 4 times a day to see if your lucky enough to get to see someone - it stinks

title: Confidence
body:
Lived in Spain since 2007.  This was my first visit to a GP in 2 years and my first visit to a UK GP, in 12 years.
In that time I've become old.
My whole experience was a delight.  I was listened to, I felt that my condition was important to the doctor and the explanation of my treatment was clear an concise.  Walking back to my car, the practice phoned with a query and used my first name, which is perfect.
Thank you very much.
Regards and best wishes, Robin Browne

title: Surgery needs  improvement
body:
About 3 years ago this was a decent practice since then drs have left and only about two resident drs there now rest are locum the appointment system is non existent very poor online doesn't work failed my family on a few occasions now
Not acceptable left and found a much better practice with online booking easy to use efficient staff so It can be done park edge needs massive improvement!

title: Speedy service
body: I called into the practice to see the nurse for a flu jab. The receptionist was very smiley and friendly. I was seen immediately no waiting around and was in and out within 5 minutes.

title: Great Help
body:
I find the staff to be a great help. I have no complaints and friendly when I have visited or spoken to them on the phone (especially one lady in particular) who took the time to listen to me and deal with my enquiry appropriately.

Keep up the good work.

author: Comper247
title: Mixed treatment
body:
When different staff are on you get different treatment one min you can go through and get a drink next time your not depending on which workers are working. It makes me feel uncomfortable especially one staff member in particular, when I come in they can be very rude and stops us getting drinks and chatting with other users because the close in 15 mins but when your homeless and cold we would appreciate 15 mins of heat and a warm drink. This makes me feel unwelcome.  
My worker for opiates I feel can be very confrontational and their attitude sometimes really effects me I actually dread going up to cgl. Things were good a few months ago but when I went up last week I noticed there was no service users engaging like there was a month ago so no one to talk to who understands. One of the peers told me to mention my experiences but don't feel I can, so they told me to come on here and say anything good and bad. I come here for help and I don't feel my worker understands my needs of my circumstances or many others I have spoken with. I know the workers are busy but I dread coming up there now and by the looks of the user turn outs everyone else feels the same. Maybe I'm not the only one?

author: herculesjq95
title: Mum's care
body: I wanted to let you know about the excellent provision by hospital@home team at Monklands hospital. The lead person was Jess but I must mention Barry, Laura Ann, Angela (Wishaw), Lou, Denise, Martin and Lauren. the entire team showed professionalism, courtesy, respect and compassion to my Mum when her condition had deteriorated to a degree that was cause for concern. I would like to thank you all for your care and cannot commend your service highly enough. This service deserves and should receive the recognition for the work it does.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Gp nurse
body: I had a very good service  from oxford today nurse was  brillient reception was good its was my first over aplointment at loxford

title: Appauling
body: Arrived at the hospital, and had telephoned the day before asking for a chaperon and was asked by reception that I didn't need a chaperon did I and replied more of a witness than a chaperon and was followed through by a nurse that ask to take my weight which I refuse as was only there as the Dr had received two letter asking to carry out annually to track development of any heart changes not to give me his very as he had done in the passed and thought that I didn't need annual echocardiograms in his view although he had received a letter from a Dr at a centre of excellence at a London hospital. He then told me he had over 50 years experience he is a GP with special interested in cardialgy lets hope he retires soon. The management there are hopeless and only part time they tell you they cannot SMS message reminders but then when you ask them about this say it is not working at the moment like their telephone lines ?.

title: Great service
body:
I called the practice asking about patient access to book an app as  been unwell for a few weeks but was purchasing over the counter meds. To be told by a receptionist we can put you on a call back for
a Gp to call you.I got a call from a Gp who i had never met but heard great reviews about from family members, we discussed my symptoms and he offered to send a five day course of antibiotics over to a chemist near my workplace. I think this was a fantastic service and would like to thank the staff for their help.

title: Fantastic and well run practice
body: Had a hip replacement, from my pre consultation to actual operation was exceptional. Everything totally organised. Would highly recommend this centre.

author: Yv75
title: Breast surgery
body:
Had my surgery in May 2018  
Iv got expanders and once they were full I was back at clinic in Dec 2018  
Where I explained and it was clearly visible one of my implants had crept up and went brick hard  
I was assured my exchange surgery would be speeded up, which hasn’t happened  
I’m also waiting on a mri for my foot which I can’t get cos of the magnets in the implants  
Here am I still waiting and very fed up

readBy.name: Office of Jackie Baillie, MSP for Dumbarton

title: Best GP practice
body:
I was diagnosed with cancer in October 2019 and the GP practice has been more than supportive and caring to me.  From talking to the receptionists (who are so helpful), pharmacist and GP nothing has been too much trouble and everything I have needed has been sorted and arranged immediately without question. 
I have found it quite emotional knowing that they are all there for me when I most need them.
You are doing a fabulous job and from my years of previous practices where we have lived, this practice has got to be the BEST ever 
Excellent service and deserves 10/10 every time 
Thank you 😊

author: Two stars and a wish
title: Two stars and a wish
body:
Two stars:  
For the lovely staff who helped me when I was scared and unsure what was happening after being referred with a breast lump.  
Especially the admin staff, the support workers and the team in the Breast Radiology Dept. They couldn’t have been nicer.  
Dr Smith is superb.  
A wish:  
I’d love there to be better communication of results. I have now received copies of my first set of results and clinic letters after asking repeatedly. However I’m still waiting to hear about a biopsy taken over four weeks ago.

author: Marstal Rose
title: My care in Argyll&bute NHS
body:
I am a mental health service user and have been for many years and at age of 45 found out i was pregnant with my first and probably only child , the care i have received in Mid argyll hospital GPs nurses and midwives and also A & B hospital mental health services have been exceptional , i have no complaints staff are always friendly know what they are doing efficient and helpful with information and further on care if needed , i was special care pregnancy what with my age , build and diabetes and mental health issues and asthma , i went on to be induced at 38 weeks as obstrician dr robins and nurses at inverclyde hospital were good too i went on to give birth at RAH in Paisley with labour 21 hours and with just gas and air all midwives from the 3 hospitals were good at keeping myself and husband calm and focused.  
my family are thriving here in mid argyll my daughter is now three years old and in perfect health Scotland and rest of uk would be no where without NHS but back to dark old middle ages and no one wants that i have nothing but praise for GPs Nurses NHS Midwives and mental health teams and Consultants ect.  
Yours Sincerely  
[Unsure about 'Environment']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']  
  
[Unsure about 'Team work']

readBy.name: Mike Russell's Office, MSP for Argyll and Bute

title: Very thorough
body: I have taken my two Grandson's aged 3 3/4 and 10 months on four occasions. I saw four different Doctors. All four Dr's were thorough, professional and friendly. My grandson's are new to the practice. I am impressed and cannot praise them enough. Your front line staff are examples of good practice. Well done!

title: Rude
body: Rang in to book and app for my son and got spoken to rudely! Told an emergency was like 5 hours time asked if there’s was any early and got told no iv told you it’s at blah blah if your that concerned go to the walk in center. Wish I had of gotten her name now! Disgusting!

author: Shan99
title: Scan results
body:
My gran had a MRI of her head done around a year ago just now and has still not had any results from this. We have chased it up at the GP and still nothing. It took a lot of convincing from me to get her to go to the scan and now she feels disappointed as no one has even let us know what has happened.  
Also, she attended her appointment for an echo 5 weeks ago at Monklands hospital and still has nothing for this. This is a worrying time for the family and would just like to know if these waiting times for results are normal? We wonder if these results are lost ?  
Thanks.

title: Lack of duty of care
body: No warm, dry waiting area at the mobile MRI unit. The morning was cold 3 deg and foggy. My wife would have had to wait for twenty minutes in those conditions had I not had the car with us. No toilets or services of any kind, disgraceful.

author: Dumbfellow
title: Reassuring and supportive dental surgery
body: Had to have a left lower molar removed. Team of three ladies - one a dental surgeon, two support staff. Called on time, entire approach extremely gentle, professional, respectful and attentive. Explained everything very well, procedure super efficient, very professional, very smoothly carried out, and completed in no time without my even being aware it was over. Very reassuring and supportive

author: they know who i am
title: Keep up the good work
body: went for a ct scan the  reception team were great telling me I could go for a pee lol was early as to miss the traffic got seen to 5 mins early fantastic no waiting nurse told me her name introduced me to the other nurse explained what would happen she was concerned about my veins as they are always hard to find but she expertly found one and inserted needle had the funny taste in my mouth and the feeling of wetting my self its not a pleasant thing but in my experience nothing to worry about at all and was in and out in 15 mins  please tell the nurses to keep up the good work the only complaint I have is the changing rooms as we have to use the xray departments and my husband said while he was waiting  one of the nurses said we usually use these but there was some one in so they had to go all the way down the corridor but not the staffs fault so thank you every one

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: Lou1997
title: My recovery
body:
I have been struggling with my mental health for many years. I have been to many different hospitals due to this and every time I would go to a new hospital they would say "I don't think this hospital is the right place for you" or "its a very complex case, we will refer you to another hospital".  
This happened continuously for about 5 years until I came to St Andrews. St Andrews healthcare did not see me as a "complex case", they saw me as someone that needed help and support.  
I am close to being discharged from hospital and now am a informal patient. St Andrews have given me my life back, all the staff are so supportive, polite and never judge you.

author: Grandaughter Lucy
title: Outstanding compassion and kindness
body:
Recently my Grannie has been a patient on the Archer Ward at Louth following a period of delirium. During her stay she became very unwell. During this time she wasn't herself and as a health care professional myself I can honestly say that the compassion and kindness in which my Grannie and I received was outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble to ensure her safety and my comfort. I was kept informed at all times about progress with care plans and our families thoughts and preferences were also taken into consideration. Well done everyone and thank you so very much  
In particular I would like to mention Dr Waha, Tammy, Nurse Michelle, Nurse Abi and HCSW Kenny as you were all exceptional thank you

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

author: thanks to physio
title: Thanks to audiology team
body:
I visited on recently without an appointment as one of my hearing aids was screeching so badly it was affecting my everyday standard of living.  
[Very unhappy with 'Noise']  
  
The receptionist Danielle was extremely helpful & found a member of staff to help me.  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
My hearing aid was replaced by someone called Laura and it is now much better.  
I have an appointment for next week but couldn't possibly have carry on with the aid as it was until then. I will still attend the appointment.  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
  
I was treated very well and didn't have to wait too long even though I was prepared to as I know that appointments are usually necessary..  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']  
  
Thank you to the team and in particular the two members of staff that I've mentioned.  
[Very happy with 'Team work']

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: Silverfox2
title: Access to 24 pharmacy experience
body:
Was advised to go to A&E one weekend recently due to a high temperature following an operation at a different hospital.  
Triage and session with doctor were very good and timely and I felt listened to and addressing my concerns. I was given a prescription for antibiotics and my wife asked at the reception desks whether they knew of a 24 hour chemist (it was close to midnight at that stage). The hospital does not have a 24 pharmacy on site and the staff on reception could not advise of a 24 hour pharmacy local to the hospital. They gave us a sheet with local pharmacies and their opening times...but that did not address the question of a pharmacy open at that time of night. Calling 111 did not help either and in the end I took the decision to wait until 9am the following morning when my wife was able to go to a pharmacy to get my prescription.  
I was fortunate that I was already on some prescribed medication following the operation. I am not sure what I would have done if I had not been in that position and not being able to get my prescribed medication from my A&E visit.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: DPR
title: Myself and connect3 at Sheffield Mind
body:
I was in a very dark place but since beginning with Terence at connect-3 I have  
*Stopped drinking Alcohol completely  
*Seen my GP on a regular basis  
*Applied for PIP  
*Felt more confident about in the community  
*Positive about my future
